Description: Nine fragments of papyrus. On recto: four fragments of the Teaching of a Man for his Son. On verso: five fragments: Teaching of Khety 9b-11a; Teaching of Khety 8c-10d; two lines of same ms?; accounts papyrus; ditto.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Published by Fischer Elfert, JEA 84 (1998), 85-92. See J. Politi 'Gurob: The Papyri and the Burnt Group', GM 182 (2001), 107 ff. Other papyri from group in UCL: to be studied by F. Hagen (Cambridge).
J. F. Quack notes (pers.comm. 2013) that EA 10775e directly joins to P. Amherst XIV (Pierpont Morgan Library) which has rubrics.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381287) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381287)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: discoloured, displaced fragments, frayed, loss, skeletal Black ink Supported overall: white paper Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Alan Henderson Gardiner
